thread.title: Drake orders £534 worth of Nando's chicken wings in Leeds - but 'nothing above Medium spice'
thread.title_full: Drake orders £534 worth of Nando's chicken wings in Leeds - but 'nothing above Medium spice'

author: Nicola Oakley
title: Drake orders £534 worth of Nando's chicken wings in Leeds - but 'nothing above Medium spice'
text:
Drake was appearing in Leeds as part of his Boy Meets World tour (Photo: Splash News) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Imagine being rich and famous, able to spend your earnings on absolutely anything that you fancy. 
Where would you choose to eat before performing a gig? The Ritz? Savoy? Or would you choose Nando's? 
Canadian rap superstar Drake has proved he's a thoroughly down-to-earth young chap by ordering a post-concert meal from the popular chicken chain on Thursday night in Leeds. 
But he didn't do it by halves, spending more than £500 on his order. That's surely an extra cheeky Nando's. 
Someone who seemingly works at the chain posted a photograph of the till screen on to Twitter showing the bill totalling £534.55. 
That's a lot of chicken and was probably ordered to feed what is undoubtedly a huge entourage. 
Unfortunately it did mean that other Nando's customers had their orders held up a bit. 
Probably not a problem they expected when they headed out for their Peri-Peri fix. Nando's decided to get in on the banter 
But it seems it was more like Medium-line Wing. A source told the Daily Mail that Drake ordered "320 medium wings, 120 Lemon & Herb wings, 25 medium chicken wraps, 25 plain chicken wraps and eight medium 1/2 chickens." 
That's nothing above medium spice, then. We thought you could handle the heat, Drake? 
According to the Yorkshire Evening Post, Drake is thought to have arrived at Leeds Bradford Airport by private jet for his Boy Meets World tour dates in the city. 
No expenses spared for Drake. 
His friend arrived to pick up the whopping amount of chicken at about 10.30pm. Like us on Facebook
